CPSC 317 – Computer Networking : Introduction Maryam R.Aliabadi What is this course all about? • What is a computer network used for? • Communication • Information sharing • Task distribution • Resource sharing • Scaling and redundancy • How do we make it work? • Communication media (wires, radio signals, etc.) • Network architecture (hosts, NICs, switches, routers, etc.) • Protocols • Applications 9CPSC 317 – Computer Networking : Introduction Maryam R.Aliabadi Why Study Computer Networking? • Unlike most courses the focus is on COMMUNICATION not computation. • What is different? Communication requires at least two parties. • Plumbing --what underlies the applications in wide use today. • The applications enabled by networking are the most disruptive technology over the past 30 years. 10CPSC 317 – Computer Networking : Introduction Maryam R.Aliabadi Course Objectives • You should become comfortable with: • writing and working with different types of programs that use computer networks • terminology about networking • key paradigms and strategies used in developing applications that use networks • applying these strategies and paradigms • basic concepts on how the Internet is put together and works 11CPSC 317 – Computer Networking : Introduction Maryam R.Aliabadi Key Paradigms and Strategies • Isolation and privacy • Data loss • Performance • Naming and
